author: Deleted User
content:
> "cost" here refers to marginal resources consumed and risks incurred by the network from processing that extra gas
<@!273808422753796097> yeah I understand that, hence my comment. The quoted paragraph talks about the network cost as if it depends on gas price, which is not true

author: schone_wizard
content: Question about 1559. If it‚Äôs targeting UI betterment among other things - can the out of gas problems be addressed too? Where you send a transaction that runs out of gas then try again and this time the combination of operation consumes less gas and you get thru

author: schone_wizard
content: It‚Äôs quite frustrating for users at these high gas prices to get an out of gas error

author: sky.cactus
content: <@!489217181104734219> I have not heard of any such solution, and it likely wouldn't fit in with EIP-1559.  If you have some ideas, I recommend proposing them over at ethresear.ch.

author: ankur2534
content: So it seems like even the simpler version of 1559 (without two separate txpools and phase-in period) won't be possible until the HF after berlin?

author: ankur2534
content: Given we average 1 HF a year, seems like that'll be 2022 at this point which is unfortunate

author: timbeiko
content: No version of 1559 will happen for Berlin.

author: timbeiko
content: Trying to pencil in another implementers' call, and then probably move to a monthly cadence so they are a bit more predictable. Would Thursday Oct 8th 14:00 UTC work for most folks?

author: schone_wizard
content: <@301186049323958275> I guess I‚Äôm a bit confused as to how it‚Äôs more of a UI EIP and not a technical given the changes proposed for gas

author: timbeiko
content: I think U*X* was meant, not U*I*. It will affect the experience of sending a transaction (quicker confirmation, lower fee).

author: schone_wizard
content: I guess in that case if fees are lowered to what they used to be, then solving the problem I‚Äôve put above becomes less relevant

author: sky.cactus
content:
> I guess in that case if fees are lowered to what they used to be, then solving the problem I‚Äôve put above becomes less relevant
<@!489217181104734219> 1559 won't fix congestion, so fees won't be "fixed".  It may help a little due to some side effects it may have on the responsiveness to congestion changes, but don't expect fee costs to be "solved" by 1559.

author: rinku6993
content: So which EIP will solve Fee cost?

author: phabc
content: Sharding and L2, maybe to some extent stateless/regenesis clients, but not as much

author: timbeiko
content:
**EIP-1559 Implementers Call #5** 
**Thu. Oct. 8th 14:00 UTC**
**Agenda**: https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/209
**Zoom Link**: To be posted in <#692078615269212180> prior to the call. Recording will be uploaded to YT.

I've added an agenda item about a "mainnet readiness checklist". I'll try and put something together in the next week or so, but the gist of it is trying to capture what are the big tasks that need to happen for this to be mainnet-ready. I expect this to change over time, but it's good to have a canonical "TODO list".
